Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Awl
Description: Awl carved in the long bone of a small animal (type XXX). One of the extremities has been carved into a sharp point while the other was left untouched at the joint. This type of object is often found in settlements where it could have been used for leather working, for example. This particular one was found in a grave.
